titles.title: Permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony to commemorate the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Oversight.
Mr. Thomas asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Voice Vote. (CR S3305)
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 02/23/1995--Passed House amended.    (There is 1 other summary). Allows use of the rotunda of the Capitol on April 27, 1995, for ceremonies to observe the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust.
